item.title: Standard Structure
item.description: Terraform modules should follow a standard structure to make them easier to use and maintain. The following structure is recommended: ROOT ├── README.md ├── main.tf ├── variables.tf ├── outputs.tf ├── LICENSE ├── modules │ ├── module1 │ │ ├── README.md │ │ ├── main.tf │ │ ├── variables.tf │ │ └── outputs.tf │ ├── module2 │ │ ├── main.tf │ │ ├── variables.tf │ │ └── outputs.tf │ │ README.md: Contains the documentation of the module and how to use it.

item.title: Public Modules
item.description: Terraform modules can be published on the Terraform Registry. This is the official registry of Terraform modules. Modules can be of three types: Official modules: published by HashiCorp Verified modules: published by a verified publisher Community modules: published by anyone When using the search bar on the Terraform registry only verified and official modules are shown by default.
